Reviews.Title: “Very, very ba choice for romantic tour in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MegaDex
Reviews.Content: Poor rooms, many things are not working properly (tv, hair dryer, air conditioning). Walls are so thin so you can normally hear other guests and some very rude children who always run through the halls during night. Oh yes, prepare for the church bells early in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: billy6654
Reviews.Content: i went there for four days with my school this week and and first it seems like a nice place at first but as the week went on it soon turned into disaster. The maids stole 20 euros off 3 people and 40 off of another! They never got their money back. I was sharing a room with three friends and it was a two person room with 4 beds in it so it was really cramped. There was also no lock on the bathroom and no shower curtain so when you had a shower the water went everywhere all over the floor. In the morning at about 7am there were bells that went on for about 15 minutes. and it was just terrible over all i wouldnt recommend this for anyone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for school trip”
Reviews.Author: LizzieRH
Reviews.Content: With its 90 second walk to Rome's Terminus station, the location could not have been better. Outdoor facilities sheltered and cool (in both senses of the word). Staff always ready to help and spoke good English. Good selection at breakfast, although the juice and coffee machines are in Italian. Good sound proofing as next to car park but couldn't tell from sound. Plenty of plug socket but some adaptors didn't fit the plugs. Bathroom faultless and clean with spacious shower. Stayed as part of a school group but would go back even with family or smaller group.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing - even for a cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: LyricalMiracle
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in plenty of cheap hotels in Italy, mainly in Rome and Florence, and this really was the worst I've ever stayed in. Shared a room with two others, and they squeezed the beds together to make three, it would have been bareable execpt we came in hot weather, and the air conditioning wasn't working, so the nights were horribly hot and sweaty. We had the window open for a breeze as the nights were still cool at this time of year, but the church bells went off every morning at 5am and they were literally 10 metres from the window... so annoying. Then someone had a bath (we couldnt have a shower cos there was no shower curtain..) and found out that the plug retractor thing didn't work, so we had a bath full of dirty water for a day and a half, that's how long it took for them to come and fix it. The breakfast was pretty average as well. It was also a very long walk into the centre of Rome, and yes its right next to the train station, but I came to Rome to visit Rome, not to leave it!!

Reviews.Title: “hostile staff”
Reviews.Author: frederica85
Reviews.Content: we went yo the lazio for my 60th my 84 year old mother and 4 others no lift to our rooms though we ask for it the lift stoped short our rooms.there wasmold in the bathrooms the plug socket was away from the wall and with no shower curtain water went everywere the fire alarm went off 5 times the next day the rude staff moved us within reach of the lift but with the hostile staff i would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A very obvious destination for schools”
Reviews.Author: SaraStardust
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, stayed here on a school trip. Although the room was decent enough, I found it too small for three people. It was obviously a two person room, with a cot added in at the last minute. The breakfast had little varirty, and while tasty and edible, became rather tedious for a five day trip. The hotels two shining glories were it's proximity to Termini (one of Rome's best shopping arcades) and the staff, who were friendly and spoke good english. The only other issue I would raise is that while most of our party were allocated rooms on the ground floor, myself and my two room mates were alone on the floor above. However, this was minor inconveinience and did not detract too much of the enjoyment of our stay. Overall, an average hotel but one of the better ones I have stayed in with my school, and average value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a school trip!”
Reviews.Author: beautifullytanbabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend on a school trip and for a girl who is used to 4-5stars, the hotel really isn't too bad. not of caution, the hotel is often full of school kids on trips wanting a good time, so not the best place if your wanting a full nights sleep. The hotel is really close to a bus station/metro/ shopping centre (termini) which it great for getting about and also the cafe at the entrance is very good for meals. The rooms... The rooms are clean some are larger than others, some of the light fittings are dodgy and check the bed slats before you leave so that you get your deposit back! NO bed bugs. Although there are very thin sheets, so if you get cold easily you might want to pack a blanket. The bathrooms clean, the showers hot and powerful, so really you can't complain. The breakfast is uninspiring! no fruit or youghurt, some cereal i'd never see before, nutella, ham and cheese for breadrolls (which are very hard...so if you have braces you might want to consider taking cereal bars or buying bread in the supermarket in the ((termin)) instead) and if you don't like long life milk i suggest you buy your own. all in all a great hotel if your only there to "sleep" and is a perfect place for school trips

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Chelsey92
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a school trip for the weekend. It is very, basic, no kettle in the room and the mini fridge is hot. Many of the bathroom sewage systems are poor so everytime the toliet is flushed it makes a terrible smell. There were no bed bugs as stated in some of the other reviews but the bed sheet sare like curtains! The staff are friendly and the general cleanleness is fine. The location is really good, right by the main train station. The breakfast is fine but the milk and water is warm so stick to the juices. All in all, its fine for a weekend away sightseeing if you are not planning to stay in the hotel much and want to be near to the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten by bedbugs, kept awake by drunk teenagers... absolutely horrific”
Reviews.Author: Slumberparty
Reviews.Content: The Lazio is really, really close to the main train station (Termini), which is very convenient - the staff were ok, especially if you smile and are friendly when talking to them, and the entrance looked ok. They have a little roofed courtyard out front, where you can sit and chill in the evenings, and there are little tobacconist's / newsagent's nearby. However, the hotel itself... well, I know it's cheap, but it was really not a great experience. The rooms are extremely cramped - don't even THINK about sharing a room with a friend, they will cram in 3 single beds into a room big enough for one bed, to the point where the 3 beds are actually TOUCHING. The rooms smelled a bit funky as well, damp and just 'off'. The worst thing was waking up the next morning and finding big red bites all over me - yes, they have BED BUGS! Gross! The hotel didn't seem to care though - they just told me to contact my tour operator... and what were they supposed to do?? The other MAJOR problem was that large groups kids going on school trips to Rome seem to be ALL staying at the Lazio... and by kids, I mean teenagers. Of course, being teenagers, they all decided to get hammered and ran around the hotel screaming and shouting, knocking on each other's doors, puking and carrying on pretty much all night. I was so annoyed. And again, the staff by the front desk did not seem to care at all. I'm so annoyed that my friends and I didn't go elsewhere - and that we didn't check this site out before booking the hotel. The breakfast did surprise me though, it was quite ok. Nothing spectacular, but really expected it to be as bad as the rest of the hotel. They had the regular continental breakfast, which is fine - cereals, bread rolls, coffee etc. in a fairly average, cleanish dining room. So to sum up - unless you're 16 and looking for a fabulously loud drunken adventure on alco pops, I'd strongly advise you to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad I ignored the reviews on this site!”
Reviews.Author: Justjayne
Reviews.Content: I booked a package which included 4 nights at this hotel, which I chose because of the close proximity to the railway station. Imagine my absolute horror when after booking I found the reviews for this Hotel Lazio on this site! We decided not to cancel and went along with a sense of humour and expecting the worst. We were pleasantly surprised - the staff were subdued, but extremely helpful when we needed them to be. The breakfast was not brilliant, but on a par with "continental breakfasts" I have experienced at supposedly better hotels. We also initially thought that the walls in our room looked a little "tired" and in need of a quick end-of-season paint, however in broad daylight we discovered that the paintwork was not in need of a refresh, but had been given an almost too subtle rag-roll pattern! Our mistake. The room we stayed in was actually spotless, with all towels changed daily and bedlinen every second day. It was well-equipped, with the exception of the mini-bar, which was really an empty fridge. However, this suited us very well, as we had plenty of space to chill our bottles of water. We found the hotel to be peaceful at night - perhaps we missed maurauding school children and bed bugs season- who knows? And yes, as promised the hotel really was a 2 minute walk (if that) from Termini - which meant that travel throughout our stay was easy. I fully believe you get what you pay for; this hotel is inexpensive and is perfect if you intend to be out-and-about site-seeing. If you are looking for a different type of break, relaxing in luxurious spacious surroundings, you should probably look at a different type of hotel. We found that this hotel delivered exactly what it promised, so don't be put off by the other reviews -try it yourself first!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Lazio.”
Reviews.Author: WorldCupper
Reviews.Content: Bugs in the beds . . . need I say more? I will though. Rude staff. Horrible smells from the AC when it did work. No TV. We were there as a part of a soccer tour but left and spent additional money to stay at the Hotel Stromboli around the corner. Lazio is located well, but there are many other choices in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs. (even if it is cheap)!!!”
Reviews.Author: thegeeenee
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel(if you could call it one) for a school trip, And it was the worst accomodation i have stayed in in my life, and ever will probably. We started off by entering the understaffed hotel, to meet a grumpy receptionest looking annoyed to see us.it took us one hour to finally get all of us in the rooms thanks to the incompetence of the receptionest. I then procceded to my room with my friends expecting a clean bed to lie on after making our long trip to Rome. But we were greeted with a smelly, dirty, termite ridden room. The sheets hadn't been changed in any of the beds, or changed for our whole 4 day trip! The air conditioning/fridge/t.v didnt work, And most importantly the safe where our valuables were supposed to go had about 5 combos that all could open and close the safe. we asked the hotel manager to see if the safe was broken or not and were not helped at all, If it wasn't for our teacher we would have probably never got assistance at all. turned out the safe had no battery and when i asked if we could replace we were given a piece of paper that explaned hoe to use the safe properly due to the ingnorance of the staff. None of them could speak recognisable english. We then decided to have a look around the room, the room was freezing so we decided to put on the air conditioning. A smell of burning pertruded from the vents so obviously it wasnt working. At close examination the scirting boards were all eatin' by termites. Next door to us there were lice all over the sheets and they had to be moved to a third floor room with all the same problems, less lice of course. Every morning we were woken at six A.M by the clicking of high heels of the staff moving up and down the corridors getting the breakfast ready. It was a collection of cheaply proccesed ham and plastic tasting cheese. The juice just wasnt juice and the coffee was cheap and dull. Overall i wouldnt recomend this hotel to anybody looking to have a gud time in rome. Even for a school trip. It is just awfull. The only thing about this haotel i can say is gud is how it looks from the outside. But indide im sure it is in violation of some serious health and safety laws. I hope you can use this review to help you make the right choice of hotel in rome. Thank You For Reading.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: WearyRomeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about our stay at the Lazio was location. We were central to the train station, the subway and many of the tourist attractions. But that's it. Our first floor room had no window and no air conditioning to speak of. No working tv, no radio nor phone. We were awaken all three nights by late night guests coming home and slamming hotel room doors. We found it very difficult to converse with the hotel staff to address some of these issues. No one seemed to speak what we'd consider fluent English. For what we paid per night for this hotel, we were VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “was it a plane???? or the school kids screaming?????”
Reviews.Author: ah0lidaymaker
Reviews.Content: FULL of school kids yelling from the windows into the open courtyard area (which provides a fantastic echo if you yell loud enough), and a constant rumble of the airconditioning unit on the roof (something like a plane taking off 24 hours a day). If you dont value peace and quite on your holiday its a great place to stay...good views from the windows of the near by apartments and very central so you can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: KingBoring
Reviews.Content: Mainly Germans frequent this cozy hotel in a converted town house near station Termini. Rooms are air-conditioned, moist and small, but the real charm of the hotel is found in its elevator, breakfast room and view of the backyard and the sourrounding, adorably old-fashioned town-houses. Faux-marble floors invite you to make yourself at home. A generous breakfast is included in the service, as well as the nice staff, who is very helpful and speaks perfectly English as well as a variety of other languages, including French and Spanish. Alex (concierge) and Mike (plumber, cleaner) were especially accommodating! I'm looking forward to spending my vacation there again and I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Student grade hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Lazio while chaperoning on my daughter's high school trip. Rooms tiny, even by European standards. Do not stay on 2nd floor; horrible smell in every room we had kids in - opening windows helped considerably, but let in street noise even though hotel is off the main street. No shower curtains in baths, but baths were clean and had good water pressure - good thing there was a floor drain. Extra beds requested for rooms with multiple kids "felt like cardboard" according to some of the kids. Breakfast starts at 6am, and if you're on the first floor, you'll hear it being prepared. Decent fare of bread, meat, cheese, tarts with juice and coffee, but great little restaurant with good pastries a block down. Also a great little pizzeria just around the corner with the nicest staff and they spoke great English. This is definitely a student trip kind of hotel; I would NEVER stay here traveling with friends or as a couple. It is an okay location. Previous review said it is "walking distance" to most sites, but all of Rome is walking distance to everything if you're willing to walk; it's a very compact city. You can walk from the the Forum in the south to the Villa Borghese in the north if you have good shoes! That review also mentioned this hotel is close to the train station - not a plus in Rome as the metro very rarely goes where you want to go; the only exception was one line that took us straight to the Trevi, and I guess you could walk anywhere else from there. There's also a nice mall under that station (Roma Termini) where the kids liked to shop.

HotelInfo.Name: Lazio
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vicenza 8, 00185 Rome, Italy
